act_pit.actname: Ministry of Lands, Parks and Housing Act

change.changenote: Section 1 definition of "municipality" BEFORE repealed by 2003-52-438, effective January 1, 2004 (BC Reg 465/2003, repealing BC Reg 428/2003).

definition.def: includes a regional district and the City of Vancouver;

change.changenote: Section 3 (3) BEFORE amended by 2004-12-30, effective March 31, 2004 (Royal Assent).

subsection.subsectiontext: The minister may, in writing, delegate the function of signing a document to another person, but that person must not exercise the function except in accordance with the instructions of the minister.

change.changenote: Section 3 (1) BEFORE amended by 2004-66-157, effective January 20, 2005 (BC Reg 16/2005).

subsection.subsectiontext: A deputy minister, a Surveyor General and other employees required to carry out the business of the ministry may be appointed under the Public Service Act.

change.changenote: Section 3 (3) BEFORE amended by 2006-1-4, effective March 28, 2006 (Royal Assent).

subsection.subsectiontext: The minister may delegate in writing, on terms and conditions the minister considers appropriate, any of the minister's powers and functions under this Act, except the powers and functions under section 2 (2) and (3), to

paragraph.paragraphtext: a government corporation, as defined in the Financial Administration Act, or
a public service employee in the minister's ministry.

change.changenote: Section 3 (4) was added by 2006-1-4, effective March 28, 2006 (Royal Assent).
Section 4 BEFORE repealed by 2000-23-50, effective March 31, 2002.

subsection.subsectiontext: Each year the minister must submit to the Lieutenant Governor in Council a report for the fiscal year ending March 31 or for the preceding calendar year respecting the work done by the ministry.
The minister must lay the report before the Legislative Assembly as soon as practicable.

change.changenote: Section 5 (b.1) was added by 2016-21-20, effective December 19, 2016 (BC Reg 323/2016).
Section 6 (b) BEFORE amended by 2003-52-439, effective January 1, 2004 (BC Reg 465/2003, repealing BC Reg 428/2003).

paragraph.paragraphtext: with any other person or a municipality.

change.changenote: Section 6.1 was enacted by 2018-47-154, effective February 5, 2021 (BC Reg 11/2021).
Section 8.1 (6) (a) and (b) BEFORE amended by 2004-66-158, effective January 20, 2005 (BC Reg 16/2005).

paragraph.paragraphtext: neither the registrar nor the government is liable vicariously, and
neither the assurance fund nor the Attorney General, as a nominal defendant, is liable under Part 20 of the Land Title Act.

change.changenote: Section 8.1 (6) (a.1) was added by 2004-66-158(a), effective January 20, 2005 (BC Reg 16/2005).
Section 9 (2) (c) BEFORE amended by 2003-52-440, effective January 1, 2004 (BC Reg 465/2003, repealing BC Reg 428/2003).

paragraph.paragraphtext: assist municipalities to establish parks and to provide outdoor recreation facilities.

change.changenote: Section 9 (3) was added by 2004-66-159, effective January 20, 2005 (BC Reg 16/2005).
Section 9 (1) (c) BEFORE amended by 2016-5-44,Sch 6, effective March 10, 2016 (Royal Assent).

subsection.subsectiontext: Without limiting subsection (1), the Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations requiring that a person using, acquiring or exercising a right or privilege in respect of Crown land pay a fee, and establishing a tariff of fees.
